results.title: Winning
results.creator_credit: Victorian Film Corporation and David Morgan
results.brief_description: Two mentally handicapped people from Hotham House, Victoria, marry. Film deals with the problems they face and the help they receive when they leave the home and move into their own flat.
results.description: Two mentally handicapped people from Hotham House, Victoria, marry. Film deals with the problems they face and the help they receive when they leave the home and move into their own flat.

results.title: Winnie the Pooh Up,Up and Away
results.brief_description: In “The Piglet Who Would Be King” , Piglet surprises his friends and becomes king of the piggies. “There’s No Camp Like Home” when a crazy, though good-natured family of Heffalumps and Woozles develop a fondness for Pooh’s honey. In “Nothing But Sweet Tooth” some mischievous pack rats snatch Pooh Bear’s sweet tooth. Rated: G

In “Nothing But Sweet Tooth” some mischievous pack rats snatch Pooh Bear’s sweet tooth. Rated: G

results.title: Winnie the Pooh the Great Honey Pot Robbery
results.brief_description: Three stories: “Pooh Oughta Be In Pictures” - Christopher Robin makes his own movie. “Trap as Trap Can” - Pooh and Piglet help Heffalump Jnr to learn about TNT. “Honey For a Bunny” - Rabbit trades with Pooh - but first he has to get honey - and escape bees. Rated: G

results.title: Winnie the Pooh discovers the seasons
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney, Rick Reinert and Ennis McNutty
results.brief_description: Christopher Robin gives Winnie the Pooh a calendar to keep track of days and seasons. Winnie and his friends discover the joys of long, warm days and Winnie learns about hibernation from the Wise Owl. With songs and music.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Walt Disney, Rick Reinert and Ennis McNutty

results.title: Winnie the Pooh Birds of a Feather
results.brief_description: Rabbit discovers true friendship when a pint-sized baby bird flutters into his life in “Find Her-Keep Her”, in “Donkey for a Day” Piglet gathers the gang together to come up with a plan to make Eeyore happy! In the third all-new adventure “Friend, In Deed”, Pooh Bear mistakenly thinking Rabbit plans to leave the Hundred Acre Wood, goes to incredible lengths to keep his lifelong friend from moving away. Rated: G

results.title: Winnie the Pooh and Tigger too (K)
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Wolfgang Reitherman and John Lounsbery
results.brief_description: Rambunctious Tigger bounces his way through this film, leaving a trail of laughter and enjoyment behind him. Poor Rabbit, driven to distraction by Tigger’s high spirits plot’s a “calming sort of lesson”.

results.title: Winnie the Pooh and the honey tree (K)
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Educational Media Company and Wolfgang Reitherman
results.brief_description: Anytime is the right time for honey according to Pooh. This film follows him through a series of misadventures brought about by a fondness for sticky treats. Suitable for children aged 4-10.
